title: Hypothermia Outcome Prediction after ECLS (HOPE) Score
description: Predicts survival probability for patients with hypothermic cardiac arrest undergoing extracorporeal life support (ECLS) rewarming to guide clinical decision-making

parameters.name: cpr_duration_minutes
parameters.description: Duration of cardiopulmonary resuscitation in minutes

parameters.name: core_temperature_celsius
parameters.description: Core body temperature in degrees Celsius

ranges.interpretation: ECLS is unlikely to confer benefit. Consider withholding ECLS and discuss goals of care with family. The expected outcome is poor with minimal chance of meaningful recovery.
ECLS rewarming is recommended. Notify ECLS-capable center and activate rewarming protocol while maintaining high-quality CPR. Reasonable chance of survival with good neurological outcome.

references: Pasquier M, Hugli O, Paal P, Darocha T, Blancher M, Husby P, et al. Hypothermia outcome prediction after extracorporeal life support for hypothermic cardiac arrest patients: The HOPE score. Resuscitation. 2018 May;126:58-64. doi: 10.1016/j.resuscitation.2018.02.026

Darocha T, Kosinski S, Jarosz A, Sobczyk D, Galazkowski R, Piątek J, et al. The chain of survival in hypothermic circulatory arrest: encouraging preliminary results when using early identification, risk stratification and extracorporeal rewarming. Scand J Trauma Resusc Emerg Med. 2016 Jun 1;24:85. doi: 10.1186/s13049-016-0281-9

Lott C, Truhlář A, Alfonzo A, Barelli A, González-Salvado V, Hinkelbein J, et al. European Resuscitation Council Guidelines 2021: Cardiac arrest in special circumstances. Resuscitation. 2021 Apr;161:152-219. doi: 10.1016/j.resuscitation.2021.02.011
formula: HOPE Score = 2.44 - 1.55*(Sex: Male=1, Female=0) - 1.95*(Asphyxia: Yes=1, No=0) - 0.0191*(Age) - 2.07*log₂(Potassium) - 0.573*log₂(CPR duration) + 0.937*(Temperature) - 0.0247*(Temperature)². Survival probability = e^(HOPE Score) / (1 + e^(HOPE Score)) * 100%
notes: Critical decision threshold at 10% survival probability for ECLS initiation
Superior to serum potassium alone (AUC 0.895 vs 0.774) for outcome prediction
Derived from 286 patients, externally validated with excellent discrimination (AUC 0.825)
Negative predictive value of 97% for HOPE score <10%
Recommended in 2021 European Resuscitation Council Guidelines
Not validated for mild hypothermia or non-accidental cardiac arrests
Most survivors (84%) have good neurological outcomes
Available at https://www.hypothermiascore.org for clinical use
